Author: ca333#0118
Content: Using the DEX and adding coins to our DEX is completely free and there is absolutely no limitation - i.e. the tech is fully open-sourced. However - the mobile DEX wallet integration isn't free since we do cover SPV server hosting, support agents, maintenance and the implementation from the 6500 USD "integration" fee. That is more than fair. If you don't like it you can still use atomicDEX core/API for your own implementation @Carsen - but please calm down and stop spreading false information.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: For the sake of decentralization and interoperability - we can't host a infrastructure, pay support agents, pay admins and infrastructure experts to monitor and maintain the network without charging for certain services - that doesn't work out if you want to offer a A+ service.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: Thats why we provide the base layer - the DEX core - completely for free. Anyone can literally just clone/fork it and build a DEX GUI on top of it.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: So you see - atomicDEX mobile is just a enduser product built on top of the free/open-source base technology.

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
Anyway - you expressed your point - i personally believe its invalid and the statements irrational - have a nice weekend! 

I conclude by saying that if you need any help using the DEX core plz feel free to contact me or our tech support at any time - we d be happy to support you with whatever needed to introduce you to the DEX layer - the mobile wallet is really just on the application layer and does NOT prevent you or any other project from using atomicDEX - i hope thats clear for you now. AtomicDEX is free, open-source and reflects our vision of interoperability & freedom.

Content: And thanks for your interest in the technology!

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
first of all its 6.5k not 7.5k - and to answer the question why BTC or LTC is listed - do you think Binance, Coinbase or ANY other exchange or service charged Bitcoin devs for listing "their" coin? The answer should answer the question. 

It is pretty much always the case that the initial listings on exchanges, wallets, crypto-services,... do orientate towards the market and likely include some of the top 10 - 20 market-cap coins since these have a huge community and userbase. The services do that in the hope to draw attention to their product since the initial userbase likely has BTC, LTC and other top cap coins.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: Anyway - lets move on. FYI - AtomicDEX mobile v0.2.1 is coming out this weekend and brings some nice improvements!
